Girona province is usually divided in 3 touristic regions:

value: region1description=Rocky cliffs and a mix of pebble beaches and sandy beaches plus Figueres, home town of Salvador Dalí.
region2description=Nice old town with an impressive Jewish quarter.
region3description=Monumental mountain towns, skying resorts and la Garrotxa volcanoes.
— nice old town with an impressive Jewish quarter
— a very old town to the West of Figueres that has a historic bridge
— southernmost resort with two botanical gardens
— a nice seaside town that also houses one of Dalí's homes
— a compact mountain town with two wineries and some good restaurants
— further West than Besalú, but worth the trip as it's a striking town perched along a narrow sliver of rock jutting out in to a canyon
— a beach resort with a reputation for its nightlife
— a pleasant old town that was once the capital of the Empúries kingdom. Now it sits at the base of a mountain that goes up to a castle.  A good day hike for those inclined
